meanings.definition: Wrinkled or contracted, especially due to loss of moisture
meanings.sent1: The apple became shriveled after being left out in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Her shriveled hands showed her age and hard work.
meanings.sent3: The shriveled balloon made a funny squeaking sound when touched.
meanings.sent4: The flowers looked shriveled, like they had been drained of color.
meanings.sent5: The shriveled leaves crunched underfoot, announcing the arrival of autumn.

meanings.definition: To become or cause to become dried up or wrinkled
meanings.sent1: If you leave the grapes out too long, they will shrivel up.
meanings.sent2: The heat of the desert sun can quickly shrivel plants.
meanings.sent3: The lack of water made the plant shrivel like a raisin.
meanings.sent4: His hopes began to shrivel as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant painting began to shrivel with age, losing its brilliance.
